chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole Joseph Wayka-Nowak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, or for any time he does not meet that requirement he must perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with S.M.S. or N.F. unless approved by agent.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
SAFE program completiton.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:38 pm 
INCLUDES 19CF167, 16CF629, 16CF109, AND 15CF1061. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Anne Renc. 

SENTENCING IN 19CF167. 
Parties have rec'd and reviewed PSI and sentencing memorandum. 
No additions/corrections. 
Argument. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>9 yrs imprisonment - 4 yrs IC & 5 yrs ES - with 273 days credit. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>AODA and follow up; absolute sobriety from controlled substances; fulltime employment/school; CC. 
COURT finds the deft eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT ORDERS sentence to run CONCURRENT to revocation sentences. 
COURT allows parties to retain PSI and sentencing memorandum and reminds them to keep them confidential. 

SENTENCING ON REVOCATION IN 16CF629, 16CF109, & 15CF1061. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF629: Ct. 1>>6 yrs imprisonment - 3 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES - with 350 days credit. 
In 16CF109: Ct. 1>>6 yrs imprisonment - 3 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES - with 350 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>6 yrs imprisonment - 3 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES - with 350 days credit. 
In 15CF1061: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with 416 days credit. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>AODA and follow up; absolute sobriety from controlled substances; fulltime employment/school; payment of any unpaid costs. 
COURT finds the deft eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT ORDERS ALL sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other.

State moves to:
16FO254>>D&RI

15CM1880>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CF629 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF1200 - Ct. 2 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY
15CF1061 - Ct. 1 (Misd Battery)>>NO CONTEST
16CF109 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
16CF109 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CM2251 - Ct. 1 (Obstructing)>>GUILTY

15CM2041 - Ct. 1 (Obstructing)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS:
15CF1200 >> $1605 inclusive; 85 days MCJ w/credit for 64 days of time already served; 15 months DL Rev w/credit; AODA and any follow up recommended; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 15 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid.

On all Misd Counts>>Sentence Wheld; 2 Years Probation, on each count.
On all Felony Counts>>Sentence Wheld; 5 years Probation, on each count.
>>All Probation to run concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: 15CF601 - Ct. 1 only>>120 days MCJ with huber if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 48 days of time already served, to begin at the end of the OWI sentence 15CF1200.
CONDITIONS on all probation counts: SAFE program completion; Absolute Sobriety; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with victims in 15CF1061 S.M.S. or N.F. unless approved by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof, or for any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must perform 10 hours of C.S./week; CC; DNA sample and surcharges.

>>COURT ORDERS upon successful completion of 5 years probation, 16CF109 and 16CF629 are to be expunged.
